subject: Philosophy
title: The Allegory of the Chariot
description: One-minute skill: The Allegory of the Chariot.

hook.text: Your soul is a chariot pulled by two horses: one noble, one wild. You're the driver trying to control both.

buildup.text: The white horse represents spirit â€” ambition, courage, honor. The dark horse represents appetite â€” desire and pleasure.

discovery.text: The charioteer is reason. Only when reason guides both horses does the soul fly upward toward truth.

twist.text: If appetite takes over, the chariot crashes. If spirit dominates unchecked, you become a fanatic.

climax.text: Plato's chariot explains the internal war everyone feels: the struggle between reason, ambition, and desire.

punchline.text: You have two horses and one set of reins. Drive wisely.

quiz.question: What does the charioteer represent in Plato's allegory?
options: Reason, which must guide spirit and appetite
